root: ^I haven't even thought that you could make it.
^Maybe there's truly something special in you?
^Also, I don't know how you missed me, but...
^My name is Kyle and I am the Grim Reaper.
^And you have already met two reapers.
^Yeah, that girl is also one of us.
^I was watching you while you went here through the dream.
^Now when you are here we can talk a bit.
^I know you have a lot of questions. But we are in a situation when I cannot answer all of them. We have not much time left.
^How much time do I have left?

q11: ^I can enter any soul bearing creature's dream.
^But this ability is quite dangerous, because a creature that becomes conscious in a dream has almost infinite power and can easily destroy me.
^You, on the other hand, can't do that right now, because your soul is weakened too much.
^How much time do I have left?
q21: ^Because you should already be dead now.
^And I don't know why you are still alive.
^I honestly thought that occasion like this is impossible.
^So it can be minutes, hours, days, maybe even weeks, months or years.
^But I guess that is not the worst of your current problems.
^What are the rules that 'prohibit prolonging someone's life'?
q31: ^Let's just transform that question into "what is happening to the whole world right now?", okay?
^Actually, I guess you already noticed it, but you haven't seen anybody else for some time, aren't you?
^Everybody else in the entire hospital is already dead.
^If we can call that a proper death.
^Somehow, a thing that we call "the dusk plague" appeared in your world.
^It is... a very dangerous 'infection', if we can call it that.
^It takes control of a creatures soul and then continues spreading itself by hunting nearest creatures that have a soul.
^We, reapers, have some kind of a resistance, so we won't get infected just by it's pressence.
^In worlds like this it spreads very fast and can destroy it in a few days.
^When I arrived here on my investigation, it was already too late to take measures.
^And, as I saw in your dream, you got infected too.
^But your decease progresses much slower than it should.
^I told you that I have never heard of a human surviving after seeing a reaper and that also applies to the plague.
^In our whole organization, only one reaper survived after getting infected until now.
^That is why I am very surprised by your condition.
^Maybe there is a chance that you will be the first exception in our history?
^How much time do I have left?
^Why do you say that we don't have much time?
q41: ^Do you mean me and that girl?
^Huh, that is a very long story.
^But shortly, there are a lot of people like me or her.
^And we all work to prevent the soul cycle from stopping.
^How much time do I have left?
q51: ^Soo, there is a set of rules that define what we should and souldn't do.
^Our main goal is to prevent the soul cycle from stopping or breaking.
^So if someone except reaper lives longer than he should, it can become a disaster in the future.
^From mass immortality to raise of soul power in human society that could lead to a full scale war with devastating powers on both sides.
^That's why we cannot make someone's life longer.
^In most cases we don't even have the ability to do so.
^I guess this rule was made for the ones like Mira.
^As I can see now, if you somehow manage to survive this madness, maybe there is a chance that our caommandment won't execute you, because you will be the only human, that survived the dusk plague.
^maybe they would be interested in keeping you safe for science?
q61: ^At first, there is a job I have to do, I shouldn't be here with you at all.
^I can't keep this drean forever and you are going to wake up soon.
^After that you probably will enter the plague's final phase, where it will try to take contol over your soul.
^While beeing here, even I can feel the pressure of the plague's effects.
^And there is a chance that you won't be able to survive that phase.
^How much time do I have left?
